content.description: This route climbs to the regional high point. Locate the steep face with a large water groove. Start out on the right by climbing a short bolted arete. Traverse left at the bulge then up into the water groove. Follow the groove to the summit. This is a good stepping stone route for 5.8 leaders. Enjoy the views.
content.protection: Eight Bolts; Bolted Anchor; Bolts were replaced in 2006 with Hilti Stainless Steel 3/8" x 3 3/4" Bolts
content.location: One must zag in from the west to the east up a series of ramps and ledges on the south face (facing the gravel road) to reach this route. The route is on the regional high point and climbs into a prominent water groove starting on the arete on the right side of the formation.

content.description: Southeast facing, offering sun in the morning and shade in the afternoon. Sheltered from the wind. Steep crystal laiden face climbing to the regional high point. Great views into Middle Earth, The Outlets, Sylvan Peak and Harney Peak. Extra summit anchors were placed for the Pumpfest that provide opportunities for interesting top ropes. Hornsby's Rock is the next tower to the east on this massif.
